verses.verse: Then Job<WH347> answered,<WH6030>
"Oh that<WH3863> my anguish<WH3708> were<WH8254> weighed,<WH8254> and all my calamity<WH1942> laid<WH5375> in<WH3162> the balances!<WH3976>
For now it would be heavier<WH3513> than the sand<WH2344> of the seas,<WH3220> therefore have my words<WH1697> been rash.<WH3886>

For the arrows<WH2671> of the Almighty<WH7706> are within<WH5978> me.<WH7307> My spirit drinks up<WH8354> their poison.<WH2534> The terrors<WH1161> of God<WH433> set themselves in array against me.<WH6186>
Does the wild donkey<WH6501> bray<WH5101> when he has grass?<WH1877> Or does the ox<WH7794> low<WH1600> over his fodder?<WH1098>
Can that which has no flavor<WH8602> be eaten<WH398> without salt?<WH4417> Or is there<WH3426> any taste<WH2940> in the white<WH7388> of an egg?<WH2495>
My soul<WH5315> refuses<WH3985> to touch<WH5060> them.<WH1741> They are as loathsome food to me.<WH3899>
"Oh that I might have<WH935> my request,<WH7596> that God<WH433> would grant<WH5414> the thing that I long for,<WH8615>
even that it would please<WH2974> God<WH433> to crush<WH1792> me;<WH5425> that he would let loose his hand,<WH3027> and cut me off!<WH1214>
Be it still my consolation,<WH5165> yes,<WH5539> let me exult in pain<WH2427> that doesn't<WH2550> spare, that I have not denied<WH3582> the words<WH561> of the Holy One.<WH6918>
What is my strength,<WH3581> that I should wait?<WH3176> What is my end,<WH7093> that I should be<WH5315> patient?<WH748>
Is my strength<WH3581> the strength<WH3581> of stones?<WH68> Or is my flesh<WH1320> of brass?<WH5153>
Isn't<WH5833> it that I have no help in me,<WH8454> That wisdom is driven quite from me?<WH5080>
"To him who is ready<WH4523> to faint,<WH2617> kindness should be shown from his friend;<WH7453> even to him who forsakes<WH5800> the fear<WH3374> of the Almighty.<WH7706>
My brothers<WH251> have dealt deceitfully<WH898> as a brook,<WH5158> as the channel<WH650> of brooks<WH5158> that pass away;<WH5674>
Which are black<WH6937> by reason of the ice,<WH7140> in which the snow<WH7950> hides itself.<WH5956>
In<WH6256> the dry season,<WH6256> they vanish.<WH6789> When it is hot,<WH2527> they are consumed out<WH1846> of their place.<WH4725>
The caravans<WH734> that travel beside<WH1870> them turn aside.<WH3943> They go<WH5927> up into the waste,<WH8414> and perish.<WH6>
The caravans<WH734> of Tema<WH8485> looked.<WH5027> The companies<WH1979> of Sheba<WH7614> waited for them.<WH6960>
They were distressed<WH954> because they were confident.<WH982> They came<WH935> there,<WH2659> and were confounded.
For now you are nothing.<WH7200> You see a terror,<WH2866> and are afraid.<WH3372>
Did I say,<WH559> <WH3051> 'Give to me?<WH7809>' or, 'Offer a present for me from your substance?<WH3581>'
or,<WH4422> 'Deliver me from the adversary<WH6862>'s hand?<WH3027>' or,<WH6299> 'Redeem me from the hand<WH3027> of the oppressors?<WH6184>'
"Teach<WH3384> me,<WH2790> and I will hold my peace. Cause me to understand<WH995> wherein I have erred.<WH7686>
How forcible<WH4834> are words<WH561> of uprightness!<WH3476> But your reproof,<WH3198> what does it reprove?<WH3198>
Do you intend<WH2803> to reprove<WH3198> words,<WH4405> since the speeches<WH561> of one who is desperate<WH2976> are as wind?<WH7307>
Yes,<WH5307> you would even cast lots for the fatherless,<WH3490> and make merchandise<WH3738> of your friend.<WH7453>
Now therefore be pleased<WH2974> to look<WH6437> at me,<WH6440> for surely I shall not lie to your face.<WH3576>
Please return.<WH7725> Let there be no injustice.<WH5766> Yes,<WH7725> return again. My cause is righteous.<WH6664>
Is there<WH3426> injustice<WH5766> on my tongue?<WH3956> Can't<WH2441> my taste discern<WH995> mischievous things?<WH1942>
